Description: 52 beads in different shapes and materials and three beads broken into fragments. A: One roughly spherical bead made of carnelian, slightly irregular, drilled from one side. B: One discus-shaped bead made of jasper. C: Four and a half flattened sphere beads, one made of red faience, three of white faience. D: Three complete and one broken segmented cylindrical bead made of white faience, all broken off at both ends. E: 43 disc-shaped beads made of faience, five of them red, six with traces of turquoise and the rest made of white faience. Five of them in a slightly larger size.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2Z [A, lowest level]
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
